item.title: Information Contagion and Echochambers
item.description: Information contagion runs rampant in the startup and venture ecosystem and produces mediocre outcomes...
item.content:encoded: Information contagion runs rampant in the startup and venture ecosystem and produces mediocre outcomes. As investors in the frontiers and fringes of technology, we are inherently supposed to invest in contrarian and/or non-consensus ideas to produce returns. Comically, investors are the most prone to groupthink. We are quick to recite talking points from the newest All-In Podcast or viral tweet. This happens in various echo chambers online and offline. This can also be extrapolated to advice given on the internet or by peers and mentors. These inputs should be weighted appropriately before applied and should not serve as a substitute for experience.

Does memory = learning?
The ability to learn is the ultimate meta-skill and acts as a multiplier on any efforts you undertake.
And since it's a skill, you can get better at it.
